Just tell me what you think of Death Metal (heavy guitars, growling vocals, and the like). I've been listening to it since I was seven. The first song I heard was from Eaten Back to Life (1990). I think it was Edible Autopsy, but I'm not sure.

Only got into it in the last few years, but I currently have a Soilwork CD in my laptop. I prefer the melodic to the growling - Soilwork or In Flames are about as heavy as I get, I'm more a fan of the Nightwish/Within Temptation/Lacuna Coil-esque/Symphony X style of symphonic metal. I don't know if any of those warrant the 'death-' suffix...

Well I couldn't say how good or bad Melodic bands are, the only two melodic bands I know of are Cradle of Filth and Arch Enemy, and I don't listen to much from either of them. My absolute favorite band is Cannibal Corpse (though I think the name's kind of repulsive). Other ones I like are Nile, Six Feet Under, Carcass, and I heard a few songs by Exhumed that I liked. I hate the lyrical content, but other than that, Deicide is pretty good.
 
 Though I seriosly think Chris Barnes should leave Six Feet Under. If you listen to their newer songs, you'll see that his vocals are getting pretty weak because his throat is wearing. I'm not a doctor, but he'll probably damage his throat if he keeps singing.
Death Metal sucks. I love the music, but the horrible vocals get on my nerves. I want to hear singing, not growling.

Well people have different ideas about death metal, but there is one boundry that can easily be defined. If it doesn't feature growling vocals, it's not death metal. It can have clean vocals, but to be death metal there has to be growling in at least part of the song. Take the Cradle of Filth song "Nymphetamine" for example, which alternates between a sweet, feminine voice and harsh growls. I'm not saying that all songs that use a growl can be considered death metal, but without a growl it can't be.

 Yep. That's why I don't like it.

And don't forget some Stevie Ray Vaughan for some radical blues. That guy can also make a guitar talk. But yeah, I'm too old for what is referred to as death metal. emoticon_xhoho

 No offense, but I think you're just used to music from a previous generation. I bet your parents didn't particulary like the music you listened to, and I bet their parents didn't particulary like the music they listened to. Each generation has a cultural movement, nothing is in style forever.

I was always irritated when my parents and especially my grandparents (all four) would tell me that Death Metal is demonic; when my parents were growing up they listened to 50s Rock & Roll which their grandparents called demonic, but that was somehow OK because it's just "not demonic".

Any of you know this band?

 I do, but in my opinion they're not that great. I prefer bands with more 'brutal' instruments and vocals in greater harmony with the instruments. Cannibal Corpse, Nile, Six Feet Under, those are my favorites. Chris Barnes was the man himself back in 92. And in my personal opinion, pink hair looks retarded, even on women.
 
 These are some of my favorites. I know hammer smashed face isn't a video but it's a great song, one of their best. I also know Sarcophagus is really not a brutal song, but it's still pretty good in my opinion.
 Cannibal Corpse - Decency Defied 
 Cannibal Corpse - Death Walking Terror
 Nile - Sarcophagus
  Six Feet Under - The Day The Dead Walked
 Cannibal Corpse - Hammer Smashed Face

Maybe one reason Hammer Smashed Face was popular because it didn't p*** off the feminists. Tomb of the Mutilated had that song among titles like Necropedophile, I Cum Blood, Post Mortal Ejaculation, and other titles that aren't particuraly feminist-friendly.

I also should mention Children of Bodom. They're not particulary brutal, but they can be proud to have Alexi Laiho, one of the 50 fastest guitarists in the world. Just listen to the solo at the beginning.
 
 YouTube - Children of Bodom - Needled 24/7
 
 Other songs I liked were Punch Me I Bleed, Everytime I Die, Bodom After Midnight, Banned From Heaven, Bed of Razors, Lake Bodom, Bodom Beach Terror, and several others.

 I don't think Ethmi uses this site anymore, but to call Cradle of Filth (or as I like to call them, Cradle of S***) "Death Metal" is Metal blasphemy. CoF is just a bunch of Faggoths (no offense to gay-rights advocates) who, subculturally, are neither Goth nor Metal. They think "Goth" and "Metal" are synonymous while the two subcultures are, in fact, completely different. They're complete posers.
 
 Also, CoF is not Black Metal. I don't listen to much Black Metal, but I know enough about it to tell you that CoF is not.
 
 This is black Metal:
 Rocktube - Satyricon - Fuel for Hatred (uncensored)
 YouTube - Gorgoroth - Carving a giant (uncensored)
